title: Enable to race on in 2020 as owner Khalid Abdullah eyes third Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe victory
text:
Enable will stay in training next season, owner Khalid Abdullah has announced.

The five-year-old came up short in her bid for a historic third Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe earlier this month, but Abdullah has decided to race on with the John Gosden-trained mare next year, with another crack at that race a possible target.

Abdullah's racing manager Teddy Grimthorpe said: 'Prince Khalid has decided to keep Enable in training for 2020.

Enable was last seen finishing second when bidding for a third Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe

'She has come out of the Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe in good form and will not race again this year.

'Her racing programme will be determined entirely on her well being, so no racing plans will be announced at this stage.

'The Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe remains an important target.'
description: The five-year-old came up short in her bid for a historic third Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe earlier this month, but Abdullah has decided to race on with the John Gosden-trained mare next year.
authors: Marcus Townend For The Daily Mail
